intro: Commiphora pyracanthoides, commonly known as the African frankincense tree, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Burseraceae family, which includes species known for producing resinous exudates. The plant is characterized by its dense, spiny foliage and small, pale green leaves. It produces a fragrant resin that has been used traditionally for medicinal and aromatic purposes. The tree thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
